skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: I am fairly new to JavaScript. I mainly use this language when developing back-end and front-end web applications.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in work teams.

skills.name: React JS
skills.description: This is the JavaScript library I mainly use to build front-end of web applications. The resume webpage you are now reading had been made using ReactJS.

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. My experience with it has been in conjunction with ReactJS-based projects

skills.name: Scikit-Learn
skills.description: This is the Python library I mainly use when I want to tackle an usual machine learning problem.

skills.name: PyTorch
skills.description: This is the Python library I mainly use when I want to train a deep learning model. I really appreciate the philosophy of this library as well as the freedom it offers to build homemade neural networks.

skills.name: Elasticsearch
skills.description: I have used Elasticsearch when building a Newsfeed application. Indeed, Elasticsearch is particularly well suited to deal with textual data.

testimonials.text: Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious. And however difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. It matters that you don't just give up.
